name: Ext_R5_EvidenceReport
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.EvidenceReport for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents EvidenceReport from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/EvidenceReport|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.definition: The EvidenceReport Resource is a specialized container for a collection of resources and codeable concepts, adapted to support compositions of Evidence, EvidenceVariable, and Citation resources and related concepts.

element.short: Canonical identifier for this EvidenceReport, represented as a globally unique URI
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this EvidenceReport when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this summary is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the summary is stored on different servers.

element.short: Canonical identifier for this EvidenceReport, represented as a globally unique URI
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this EvidenceReport when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this summary is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the summary is stored on different servers.
The status of this summary. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
The status of this summary. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate evidence report instances.

element.short: Identifiers for articles that may relate to more than one evidence report
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify things closely related to this EvidenceReport.

element.short: Name of the publisher/steward (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual responsible for the release and ongoing maintenance of the evidence report.

The root of the sections that make up the composition.
The label for this particular section.  This will be part of the rendered content for the document, and is often used to build a table of contents.
The label for this particular section.  This will be part of the rendered content for the document, and is often used to build a table of contents.
A code identifying the kind of content contained within the section. This should be consistent with the section title.

A definitional Resource identifying the kind of content contained within the section. This should be consistent with the section title.

element.short: Who and/or what authored the section
element.definition: Identifies who is responsible for the information in this section, not necessarily who typed it in.

element.short: Who and/or what authored the section
element.definition: Identifies who is responsible for the information in this section, not necessarily who typed it in.

element.short: Text summary of the section, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains the attested content of the section, used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is peferred to contain sufficient detail to make it acceptable for a human to just read the narrative.
The status of the narrative - whether it's entirely generated (from just the defined data or the extensions too), or whether a human authored it and it may contain additional data.
The status of the narrative - whether it's entirely generated (from just the defined data or the extensions too), or whether a human authored it and it may contain additional data.

binding.description: The status of a resource narrative.

element.definition: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.

element.short: Data type name for Narrative.div from FHIR R5
element.definition: Data type name for Narrative.div from FHIR R5
The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.

How the entry list was prepared - whether it is a working list that is suitable for being maintained on an ongoing basis, or if it represents a snapshot of a list of items from another source, or whether it is a prepared list where items may be marked as added, modified or deleted.
